rComments: After taking several classes with Professor Bothwell I can honestly say he is one of my favourite professors at U of T. He is VERY knowledgeable about his subject area and always has entertaining stories to share about people he has met and interviewed. Would highly recommend any of his classes.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Professor Bothwell's HIS311 class is an essential experience for any UofT history, IR, or polisci student. It's rare that you sit back in class and think: "This is the best education I can receive on this topic from anyone, anywhere in the world". Bothwell is THE foremost authority on the subject, and it was a privilege to learn under him.
Bothwell is AMAZING! He makes history so fun and engaging. Be prepared to take lots of notes and pay attention in lectures.

He's an older white man who uses his own books as source material, but don't let this fool you. Bothwell is AMAZING! His lectures are funny, entertaining, and very engaging. He makes the material fun and interesting. Keeping up in lecture can be a bit of a challenge because he covers A LOT in an hour, but he is worth it. Can't recommend enough!!!

Bothwell is an incredibly knowledgeable prof - no notes, no slides, just him reciting lectures from memory. He's super funny and makes what is usually a boring topic actually very interesting. Would absolutely recommend his class, though you definitely have to put in the work on papers and in tutorials.

Bothwell's HIS311 lectures are SO GOOD. He literally wrote the book on Canadian history and he's a wonder to listen to. Tough side of this course is all from the TAs. They mark hard and expect a lot from you. Like 15 sources for a 1000 word essay a lot from you. Tutorials are the difficult part of this class.
A total buffon.

Best lecturer I've had so far, he can speak for the full hour from memory without notes or slides, he's clearly very knowledgeable. Lectures are also entertaining, he's a funny guy, his impressions of political figures especially.

Professor Bothwell is the charming, heart and soul of U of T. His short, snappy sentences make his lectures clear and to the point. He uses his own real life experiences to add comic relief especially when covering heavy periods in history. You do need to pull up your socks and work in this course because his TAs are very strict. Good luck!

Prof. Bothwell was one of the best professor's I've ever had at U of T. He made me want to pursue history beyond my undergrad. Loved his lectures, loved his seminar class. He's clear, he's an expert on the subject matter, he's passionate about the material, and he cares about his students. Very helpful to students dropping by his office hours

Bothwell is one of the funniest profs I've had (may include getting on top of a table and re-enacting a death scene). His lectures were very content-heavy, but so well-delivered and interesting. Beware the readings - they are many, and they are long. If you fall behind, you're going to have a heck of a time catching up.

Although the material was dry in the course, Bothwell made it fun and interesting. He often went off on a tangent of how he had  personally met the guy or some little known fact that made the class bearable.
Engaging and downright fun. The hour flies by.

His lectures are entertaining to say the least, but I am not looking to be entertained but just to take this course for credit. The main problem I had is with the structure of this course, tutorials are mandatory and worth a lot, there is also a lot of readings for tutorial.
He is absolutely brilliant. He could have retired, or only be teaching graduate classes. Why does he stay? Because he loves his students.
Great Prof. He is a walking encyclopedia and is very entertaining
Probably the worst course and lecturer at uoft. I wish he would retire and let some young blood come into IR so we wouldn't be bored to death by his irrelevant anecdotes.

To the poster below...I was in the same class. I came to school to be challenged, not to be entertained. This course was a joke. I learned nothing, and was amazed at the sheer liberal bias to the readings/trajectory of the material taught. Would not take again.

Favourite professor! Professor Bothwell is an incredibly good lecturer, he keeps you interested throughout the class and sprinkles his lecture with hilarious jokes/asides/impressions. Plus he is extremely approachable and helpful in his office hours. I recommend this class to all history students! no regrets here!
BORING!!!!!!!!!
He is SO biased. And his classroom isn't about education. It's about thinking his way or no way at all!

closed to any opinion not out of his own finding, and an historian of the Whig stripe. the bias and unwillingness to be open to other ideas was exceptionally visible in this course and detracted from it. very anti-social science.

Best professor EVER, hands down. Entertaining, and doesn't try to haze history over... actually cuts to the important stuff. I learned more about Canadian history in his class than I did in all previous years combined.
Simply one ofthe best profs @ UofT.
The best prof out there.  If you can take his course, you should.

Au contraire, I think ONLY he can make Canadian foreign policy that interesting. Obviously an intelligent guy, read his books, they're good, but most importantly he makes history come alive. I wish more profs were like Bothwell.
An eloquent and sophisticated instructor who saw through all my tricks and taught me to truly think as an academic historian.

Bothwell's lectures are very often like story-time, which can either be very interesting or challenging, depending on your learning style. He makes you more interested in learning further about topics like the Cold War, etc and he looks like Santa Clause!
Good and intelligent Professor.
A wonderful professor who was very entertaining. A brilliant man, truly impressive.
yeah, i admit,this guy knows everything BUT his lectures are so boring. even he can't make 'canadian foreing policy' interesting.  once again, BORING, even though it's not his fault.
This guy knows everything.  Seriously.  Sometimes his lectures are overwhelming, but he is extremely approachable, has a good sense of humour and is a great lecturer.

Bothwell was by far the most superb lecturer at U of T. His personal anecdotes and sense of humor made classes interesting and made students really want to learn more about Canadian External Relations. Best class I have ever taken!
Great professor! However, he tends to wander off on topics such as handsome generals etc.  Straight folks should be aware that this is a blend of history and " alternative" indoctrination.
Great lecturer... even better to talk to.  I swear he knows everything
Incredible lecturer. Best I've had at U of T.
Witty and interesting - very enjoyable.
best prof at u of t
excellent command of material, witty-this course is unsafe for slackers-be warne
Am I the only one who thinks Bothwell is the best lecturer at U of T?
